intro: Haplophyllum broussonetianum, commonly known as the African snowball, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to tropical Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters in height, characterized by its dense, white, fluffy flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in forest margins or secondary vegetation. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses in warm climates.
